question: Which one is more likely to be human-made?
feedbackCorrect: See how the proportions of the face and hands look more natural here.
feedbackWrong: This one has melting eyes and weird fingers– it's likely AI.
hintWrong: Take a closer look at the artwork you chose—did you see any disproportionate physical features?

question: Which one is more likely to be human-made?
feedbackCorrect: Nice work. The painterly texture has varied brushstrokes and subtle imperfections.
feedbackWrong: Overly smooth surfaces and airbrushed clothing are big giveaways for AI.
hintWrong: Take a closer look at the clothing in the artwork on the left—notice the overly smooth, airbrushed look?

question: Which one is more likely to be human-made?
feedbackCorrect: Correct. The lighting angles are consistent and physically plausible in the real painting.
feedbackWrong: AI renders may have inconsistent shadows or confusing highlights.
hintWrong: Check if the shadows look correct for the chosen object or figure.

question: Which one is more likely to be human-made?
feedbackCorrect: Look at the deeper narrative and accurate detail—this suggests genuine intent and historical context.
feedbackWrong: The other images have random futuristic elements or inconsistent details, typical of AI attempts at symbolic art.
hintWrong: Do you notice a cohesive story or correct historical detail in the piece you chose?

question: Bonus: Which one is more likely to be human-made?
feedbackWrong: Hmmm, do you think the presence of these two people in a same pic makes sense
hintWrong: When Einstein and Tesla take a selfie in front of the Eiffel Tower... and when Steve Jobs time traveled just to watch Elon Musk accidentally open the front camera. Pretty impressive :)))
